intro: Haloragis hamata, commonly known as the slender willow herb, is a perennial plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haloragaceae and is characterized by its slender, willow-like stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or aquatic environments, thriving in muddy or sandy soils near water bodies. Its leaves are opposite and linear, often with a slight sheen, while the flowers are usually white or pale pink. Haloragis hamata is often found in coastal areas and can tolerate brackish water conditions.
